intro: Carpodinus acida, commonly known as the sour fig, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to parts of Africa and is characterized by its small, sour-tasting berries. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a slightly hairy texture. The flowers are small and white, clustered in inflorescences, and the fruit is a drupe that turns from green to yellow or red when ripe.
